programme.title: FA Cup Final Classics
programme.desc: We revisit the 1995 FA Cup final between Everton and holders Manchester United. United were looking to avoid having their first barren season for six years.(n)

programme.title: FA Cup Final Classics
programme.desc: We revisit the 1996 FA Cup final between Manchester United and Liverpool. Eric Cantona was looking to become the first captain from outside the British Isles to lift the trophy.(n)

programme.title: FA Cup Final Classics
programme.desc: We revisit the 1997 FA Cup final between Chelsea and Middlesbrough. Chelsea, managed by Ruud Gullit, went in to the match hoping to win their first major trophy in 27 years.(n)

programme.title: FA Cup Final Classics
programme.desc: We revisit the 1998 FA Cup final between Arsenal and Newcastle. The Gunners were looking to emulate the famous 1971 league and cup double winning side.(n)

programme.title: FA Cup Final Classics
programme.desc: We revisit the 1999 FA Cup final between Manchester United and Newcastle. The Reds entered the match as Premier League champions having clinched the title the previous weekend.(n)

programme.title: FA Cup Final Classics
programme.desc: We revisit the 2000 FA Cup final between Aston Villa and Chelsea, the last final to be played at the old Wembley Stadium. This was Aston Villa's first final appearance since 1957.(n)

programme.title: FA Cup Final Classics
programme.desc: We revisit the 2001 FA Cup final between Arsenal and Liverpool at the Millennium Stadium, the first final in which the managers of both teams were from outside the British Isles.(n)

programme.title: FA Cup Final Classics
programme.desc: We revisit the 2002 FA Cup final between Arsenal and Chelsea. Freddie Ljungberg was aiming to become the first man to score in successive Cup finals since Bobby Smith for Tottenham.(n)

programme.title: FA Cup Final Classics
programme.desc: We revisit the 2003 FA Cup final between Arsenal and Southampton at the Millennium Stadium. The final was the first to be played indoors; the roof was closed due to bad weather.(n)

programme.title: FA Cup Final Classics
programme.desc: We revisit the 2004 FA Cup final between Manchester United and Millwall. The Lions became only the second team from outside the top flight to reach the final since 1982.(n)

programme.title: FA Cup Final Classics
programme.desc: We revisit the 2005 FA Cup final between Arsenal and Manchester United. This was the first final to have been decided via penalty shootout.(n)

programme.title: FA Cup Final Classics
programme.desc: We revisit the 2006 FA Cup final between Liverpool and West Ham. This six-goal thriller is widely regarded as one of the greatest finals in the history of the competition.(n)

programme.title: FA Cup Final Classics
programme.desc: We revisit the 2007 FA Cup final between Chelsea and Manchester United. This was the first competitive game to be held at the new Wembley.(n)

programme.title: FA Cup Final Classics
programme.desc: We revisit the 2008 FA Cup final between Cardiff City and Portsmouth. Cardiff were hoping to become the first club from outside England's top division to win the cup since 1980.(n)

programme.title: FA Cup Final Classics
programme.desc: We revisit the 2009 FA Cup final between Chelsea and Everton. The Toffees were looking to win their first piece of major silverware since winning this competition in 1995.(n)

programme.title: FA Cup Final Classics
programme.desc: We revisit the 2010 FA Cup final between Chelsea and Portsmouth. Newly crowned Premier League champions Chelsea were looking to win the double for the first time in their history.(n)

programme.title: FA Cup Final Classics
programme.desc: We revisit the 2012 FA Cup final between Chelsea and Liverpool. The only time both sides had previously met in a domestic cup final was the 2005 League Cup which Chelsea won 3-2.(n)

programme.title: FA Cup Final Classics
programme.desc: We revisit the 2013 FA Cup final between Manchester City and Wigan Athletic. This was the Latics' first FA Cup final appearance, while City were making their 10th.(n)

programme.title: FA Cup Final Classics
programme.desc: We revisit the 2014 FA Cup final between Arsenal and Hull City. The Gunners were looking to secure their first piece of major silverware since winning this competition in 2005.(n)

programme.title: FA Cup Final Classics
programme.desc: We revisit the 2015 FA Cup final between Arsenal and Aston Villa. The Gunners were defending champions and were aiming to become the all-time record winners with a 12th success.(n)

programme.title: UEFA Champions League Magazine
programme.desc: Ex-Liverpool star Steven Gerrard remembers his greatest night - the 2005 UEFA Champions League final. Plus, a profile of PSG's Kevin Trapp and a preview of the quarter-final ties.(n)
